# useStoredAccessor()

**Type Method**

Returns `true` if the stored value methods [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/storedValue(forKey:)] and [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/takeStoredValue(_:forKey:)] should use private accessor methods in preference to public accessors.

## Declaration

```swift
class func useStoredAccessor() -> Bool
```

## Discussion

Returning [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NO] causes the stored value methods to use the same accessor method or instance variable search order as the corresponding basic key-value coding methods ([doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/value(forKey:)] and [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/takeValue(_:forKey:)]). The default implementation returns [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/YES].

Applications should use the `valueForKey:` and `setValue:forKey:` methods instead of `storedValueForKey:` and `takeStoredValue:forKey:`.

## Deprecated Class Methods

- **defaultPlaceholder(for:with:)**: Returns an object that will be used as the placeholder for the `binding`, when a key value coding compliant property of an instance of the receiving class returns the value specified by `marker`, and no other placeholder has been specified.
- **setDefaultPlaceholder(_:for:with:)**: Sets `placeholder` as the default placeholder for the `binding`, when a key value coding compliant property of an instance of the receiving class returns the value specified by `marker`, and no other placeholder has been specified.
